questions.text: Who originated the role of Tevye, the milkman, in the revival?
questions.explanation:
Alfred Molina.

	Alfred Molina has been seen in "Spider-Man 2" and "Frida". Topol played Tevye in the movie, and Josh Mostel is the son of Zero Mostel, who originated the role in the original production in 1964.

questions.text: Where does the majority of the action take place?
questions.explanation:
Anatevka.

	All the characters live in a small, isolated Russian village called Anatevka. Perchik came from Kiev after studying at the university, and Siberia is where Perchik is imprisoned. At the end of the show, several characters decide to move to America.

questions.text: Which song was added to this production that was not in the original 1964 Broadway production?
options: We Haven't Missed a Sabbath Yet
If I Were A Rich Man
questions.explanation:
Topsy-Turvy.

	"Topsy-Turvy" is sung by Yente, the matchmaker, and two other women. "Tradition" and "If I Were A Rich Man" were in the original run, and "We Haven't Missed a Sabbath Yet" was not used in the revival.

Randy Graff.

	Randy Graff has also been seen in "Les Miserables" and "City of Angels". When she left the cast, Rosie O'Donnell took her place. Maria Karnilova played Golde in the original 1964 production.

questions.text: The revival was nominated for six Tony Awards. How many did it win?
questions.explanation:
None.

	Although it was nominated for Best Actor in a Musical, Best Featured Actor in a Musical, Best Revival of a Musical, Best Scenic Design, Best Lighting Design and Best Orchestrations, the revival didn't win any awards. Nor did it win any Drama Desk awards.

questions.text: Who originally played Motel in the production?
questions.explanation:
John Cariani.

	John Cariani was nominated for a Tony Award for his role as Motel, the timid tailor who is in love with Tevye's eldest daughter, Tzeitel. The revival production was his Broadway debut.

questions.text: Who began playing Tevye on 4th January, 2005?
questions.explanation:
Harvey Fierstein.

	Harvey Fierstein took over as Tevye from Alfred Molina. Harvey has previously been seen in "Hairspray" and in "Torch Song Trilogy". He has a very gravelly voice, one of the most distinct in all of musical theatre.

David Leveaux.

	While Jerome Robbins choreographed and directed the original 1964 production, Tony award nominee David Leveaux was tapped to direct the 2004 revival. Norman Jewison directed the movie.

questions.text: When everyone leaves the village at the end of the show, the fiddler gives something to a young boy. What is it?
questions.explanation:
A fiddle.

	The fiddler gives his fiddle to the young boy, the only one left to start over.

questions.text: Out of all these characters, which one has been played by the same person throughout the entire run of the show?
questions.explanation:
Yussel.

	Enrique Brown, who played Yussel, never left the production while Alfred Molina, Randy Graff and John Cariani did and had to be replaced.
